events.name: FREE Family Code
events.description:
Do you have a child that is interested in computers and learning to code? That's awesome, bring them with you to family code!

Please RSVP via Eventbrite https://www.eventbrite.com/e/tts-kids-code-tickets-44574230724

Kids ages 8-12 are invited to join you and Tech Talent South for an afternoon of code on Tuesday from 4:00pm-5:00pm during our FREE 4-week Family Code Program (https://techtalentsouth.com/courses/free-kids-code/)

This is a great way to spark your childâ€™s interest in STEM and to get an early start at developing a truly valuable skill set. Each class builds on the week before, and we would love to have you and your child join us for all 4 sessions.

Curriculum/Schedule:

Week 1, Tuesday April 17: HTML
Week 2, Tuesday April 24: CSS
Week 3, Tuesday May 1: Ruby Lesson 1
Week 4, Tuesday May 8: Ruby Lesson 2

What to bring?
Please make sure you and your child comes with a personal laptop (Chromebooks are acceptable) and a power cord for the laptop.

Your child must be accompanied and supervised by a parent or guardian at this event.

If you have any further questions, please contact [masked]

events.name: The Charlotte iOS Developers Monthly Meetup

events.name: Community Action Night!

venue.name: Hygge Coworking at Camp North End

events.description:
Hey you! We are a group of amazingly talented (brushing the shoulders off) and civic-minded volunteers that want you to join us in making Charlotte a better place! We work with city departments and local organizations to create digital platforms that help Charlotte residents better interact with the Queen City. PS- make sure you read everything in this description for directions to our location and what you can expect your first night!

Coding and programming are just a portion of the work we do. Our projects require project managers, designers, storytellers, writers, researchers, marketers, user experience designers, and fundraisers! Regardless of your skill level, we need you here and will give you opportunities to increase and practice any skill you do want to develop!

Are you still on the fence about how you could contribute? Come on now- we got you! We are always looking to engage our community in what they need and how we could build it! Join us for one of our monthly community nights, network with our team, support our message and support Crown Town!

We firmly believe that our government and our community can be better but only by working together. We are rolling up our sleeves and using our combined skills to make that happen. Join us! Check out this video (https://www.ted.com/talks/jennifer_pahlka_coding_a_better_government?utm_source=tedcomshare&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=tedspread)and learn about the story of our origin, and then check out our website (http://www.codeforcharlotte.org/) to get involved!

Entrance and Parking: The entrance to Camp North end is at 1830 Statesville Ave. Once you're inside Camp North End: Follow signs for The Mount! Follow the driveway all the way down to the end. There will be shipping containers on your right, TURN RIGHT and then take your immediate LEFT JUST after the shipping containers. Follow that road around the bend and you'll see the 2nd area with patio furniture and lights. Park anywhere near there and look for the black and yellow building. We're in there! Still not sure? Check out this map:

What To Expect Your First Night: Besides helping yourself to free drinks and pizza, we have a little orientation that tells the story of how we started, what we do and what are we working towards! After the orientation, you can meet some of our members or jump in and work with us! We have a GitHub repository that we'll show you how to access, so if you wanted to dive in make sure to bring a laptop!
events.how_to_find_us: We can't stress this enough- PLEASE READ the Entrance and Parking section below and check out the map. It will save you from getting lost your first time finding us.

events.name: Tear Down Tuesday
events.description:
Join Rob in taking apart basic electronics devices(rc cars,widgets etc), understanding how they work, and potentially using an arduino to make them do other things.

We recommend you bring a Remote Control Car to your first meeting (one that you don't mind taking apart). You can often find RC Cars at the thrift store for just a few bucks.

Adults and children (>= 5) are welcome. An adult will need to attend with a young child.

We hope to see you Tuesday night.

events.name: Beer and Configuration Manager - Old Mecklenberg Brewery

group.name: Charlotte, NC  MS System Center Configuration Manager Meetup

events.description:
Join us as we reboot this user group. This is a casual meetup with no PowerPoint or demos, just some fun loving experts. Share the beverage of your choice with a bunch of Microsoft Engineers for an evening of all things Configuration Manager.
- Bring your questions!
- Bring your ideas for a better user group!
- Bring your SCCM problems!
- Bring a friend (or make new ones at the Meetup)!
- Discuss how to learn more about Configuration Manager!

Don't have any questions? Just want to learn more about how to use Configuration Manager? Be sure to join us and find out how to learn more.
events.how_to_find_us: We hope to be outside at the picnic tables.  Will post exact spot to find us in the brewery by 5:30 pm.

events.name: Team America Rocket Challenge
events.description:
Design a rocket to compete in the TARC.

First of the 3 R's, Rockets are how humans explore the frontier. TARC is a great opportunity for Primary Students to get their feet wet.

We'll learn how to use OpenRocket to design, simulate, build and test rockets.

This is an ongoing activity with an important kickoff on Jan 1.

events.name: Make.Learn.Share  "OPEN HOUSE"
events.description:
Make (almost) Anything. We're interested in CNC Machines, 3D Printers, Metal work, Jewelry, Robots, Rockets, Circuits of all stripes, and cool DIY projects. Bring your ideas, games, socialize and have some fun. This meetup is an open house for all members and any NEW COMERS interested in learning what we're all about. Come check out our NEW MakerSpace Charlotte home!

Check our our full calendar with classes and events...

www.MakerSpaceCharlotte.org

events.name: SharePoint and Power BI â€“ Better Together
events.description:
Join us as Daniel Christian, Microsoft MVP will talk about the deep integration between SharePoint and Power BI.

SharePoint is still very much a platform for integration and for Business Intelligence content delivery and Power BI takes that to a whole new level. In this meeting Daniel will cover the deep-integration between SharePoint and Power BI both online and on-premises.

If youâ€™re learning SharePoint reporting or Power BI then you donâ€™t want to miss this Meetup!

events.name: Let's try Computer Science: Algorithms, recursion and loops
events.description:
My oh my...algorithms, recursion, and loops.

I will demonstrate each concept by solving a single challenge.

If you just watch, you will be at least 1% less scared of all three terms.

If you code along, you may be 10% less scared.

events.description:
Friday night has become a popular social event at MakerSpace and we want to make it am official meetup! Please don't forget to RSVP.

Make (almost) Anything. We're interested in CNC Machines, 3D Printers, Metal work, Jewelry, Robots, Rockets, Circuits of all stripes, and cool DIY projects. Bring ideas or your game and lets have some fun. Calling all COS PLAY folks, MakerSpace can be a great place to build your costumes too!

events.name: Charlotte Microsoft Azure Bootcamp
events.description:
Charlotte Microsoft Azure Group is pleased to announce Global Azure Bootcamp Charlotte - a full day conference about the Microsoft Azure Cloud Computing Platform. The event is taking place in Charlotte Microsoft Campus on 21st April 2018. It is free and open for everybody to join.

Azure has grown leaps and bounds over last few years, and so has the diversity of our audience. Accordingly, we plan to run multiple tracks this year, where everyone irrespective of their profile has something to learn and work upon. Looking forward to a fun filled learning day with everyone!

Agenda:

8:30 to 9:00 am

Welcome & Breakfast

9:00 to 10:00 am

Making high availability and disaster recovery easy with Azure IaaS - Evan Basalik

Implementing DevOps with Azure Platform - James Davis

Lab: Containers with Azure platform - Peter Lasne

10:15 to 11:15 am

Deploying Container workloads on Azure Platform - Peter Lasne

Developing Microservices with Azure Platform - John Dandison

Lab: Azure DevOps - James Davis

11:30 to 12:00 pm

Keynote: Cloud Transformation at Wells Fargo - Jasper Rajesh, Technology Manager at Wells Fargo Enterprise Cloud Services

12:00 to 1:00 pm Lunch

1:00 to 2:00 pm

Building IoT solutions with Azure Platform - Eddie Gotherman

Azure Machine Learning - Bhakti Liyanage

Lab: Azure Cognitive Services - Richard Taylor

2:15 to 3:15 pm

Data Architectures with Azure Platform - Melissa Coates

Creating nexgen applications with Azure Cognitive Services - Richard Taylor

Lab: Azure IoT - Eddie Gotherman

3:30 to 4 p.m.

Closing Note & Giveaways

events.name: Eat Food and Pythonate as Usual in a New Venue

venue.name: 7th Street Market
venue.address_1: 7th St is last stop on light rail

events.description: Trying out a new location. By popular demand, we're going to change the pattern of who gets to drive how far this month by meeting in a more central location -- 7th Street Market. This place is directly across from the 7th Street Light Rail Stop. There's a photo of it here: http://charlottenc.gov/cats/rail/lynx-blue-line/Pages/7th-street-station.aspx. Too easy. Pure Pizza is straight ahead more or less as you go through the main doors. Bring hunger and your Python brain, or your regular brain is fine too.
events.how_to_find_us: We'll try to grab a table near Pure Pizza.

events.name: d&r#1 - Dissect & Recreate a Super MARIO wanabe! part 1
events.description:
Now who doesn't love a great old school game? ... well most of us do right?

(Artist, writers, Composers, are encouraged to come and network or showoff your skillz!)

In this Dissect & Recreate, we work our way to the oldies but goodies, by dissecting Super Mario Bros (created by NintendoÂ®).

We take some time to understand the story, art, music and mechanics, along with most pieces required to make the game. Once we have a decent understanding, we put it to practice and create our own rendition of the old school favorite; by using royalty free assets and code created by yours truly!

By understanding the basic functionality of the game and the pieces that make the whole thing happen, we can push our knowledge to the next level!

Thanks to: YOUR LOCAL GAME STORE for providing the space for this meetup. Please come earlier to browse, purchase, or experience this amazing place!

********************* Requirements and Notice *********************
**(Note: All participants are required to bring their own equipment and have Unity 3d installed, https://store.unity.com/download?ref=personal )

**Some coding knowledge is required for those who want to follow training or venture further.

**Teams are always encouraged!!
events.how_to_find_us: Join us upstairs and enjoy some of their great drinks!

events.name: Explore Emerging Enablement Electronics
events.description:
Explore how Emerging Technology can be applied to improve the lives of the differently abled.
We have delivered an Alexa Voice controlled blanket for a quadriplegic, and we are exploring ideas for our Blind friends. If you have ideas or a project or know someone how could benefit from emerging technology, do chime in.
